metadata.title: CVE-2022-3775 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: When rendering certain unicode sequences, grub2's font code doesn't propervalidate if the informed glyph's width and height is constrained withinbitmap size. As consequence an attacker can craft an input which will leadto a out-of-bounds write into grub2's heap, leading to memory corruptionand availability issues. Although complex, arbitrary code execution couldnot be discarded.

criterions.comment: grub2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'does not impact secure boot').
grub2-unsigned package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
grub2-signed package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
